design_row.threat_description: SQL injection in policy search endpoint /policy/search
Weak TLS configuration with outdated OpenSSL 1.0.2
S3 bucket with public read ACL exposing customer documents
Transitive dependency on log4j 2.14.1 with RCE vulnerability
Overly permissive IAM role allowing s3:* actions
Missing input validation on claims submission
Hardcoded API keys in configuration files
Unencrypted data at rest in analytics database

non_cve_findings.message: SQL injection vulnerability detected in policy search endpoint. User input is directly concatenated into SQL query without parameterization.
Hardcoded credentials detected. API key is stored directly in source code.
Weak password validation allows passwords shorter than 8 characters.
Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability. User input is rendered without sanitization.
Server certificate validation is disabled, allowing man-in-the-middle attacks.
OS command injection vulnerability. User input is passed to Runtime.exec() without validation.

enhanced_decision.summary: Consensus REVIEW at 72.3% confidence across 6 findings.
